topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/554b931b6368722ad9613800#post_554b931b6368722ad9613800
Oh Christ!

We actually had a dog kind of like that with the bed thing, though it was sad because she tried so hard but she actually couldn't jump.

She had super stubby legs. 


Also I remember when I first got my little Dog I left with my Sister and her Husband to go to walmart and when I came back she like destroyed my room.

She went into my rooms bathroom (We used to live in a house that had a bathroom in my room) and she took all the toilet paper and destroyed it.

And than she jumped on my bad and chewed up some of my covers and destroyed my tv remote! You should have seen it! The remote looked like it got burnt in acid!

topics.body:
"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/554b96016368726e90250200#post_554b96016368726e90250200
I was really glad he was as snarky as he was. He's apparently a lot more robotic in the comics which I don't think would have played as well on film. 

Also if I have a complaint about ultron it's that I think he's way more intimidating with the unmoving drone face than his emotive normal face. I dunno, I guess being able to read his expression makes him less scary to me.

[bq="Too_Offensive"]"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/554b96016368726e90250200#post_554b96016368726e90250200
I was really glad he was as snarky as he was. He's apparently a lot more robotic in the comics which I don't think would have played as well on film. 

Also if I have a complaint about ultron it's that I think he's way more intimidating with the unmoving drone face than his emotive normal face. I dunno, I guess being able to read his expression makes him less scary to me. [/bq]
Oh yeah, it would be a bit more better if Ultron keep his always angry and smily face of robot, with his snarky personality.

My brother got confused a lot because Quicksilver and Scarlet Witch had a different backstory.
